intro: Hieracium crebridentiforme, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from June to August. Hieracium crebridentiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
